content: Which French artist, known for his paintings of ballet dancers, was also a sculptor and printmaker in the Impressionist period?

I believe the artist you're referring to is Edgar Degas. He was a prominent figure in the Impressionist movement, although he preferred to be called a Realist. Degas is renowned for his depictions of ballet dancers, as well as his portraits and scenes of urban life. In addition to painting, he was also skilled in sculpture and printmaking, further establishing his versatility as an artist.
